item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Teases Trial Characters for Imaginarium Theater
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Genshin Impact leak is teasing the Trial characters players will be able to use during the first cycle of the upcoming Imaginarium Theater game mode.
  • The first rotation of the Imaginarium Theater will reportedly allow players to use Thoma, Kuki Shinobu, and Faruzan as Trial characters to add to their party.
  • Imaginarium Theater is expected to launch with the Version 4.7 update alongside two new five-star characters, an update to the Archon Quest, and new Genius Invokation TCG cards.

A recent Genshin Impact leak is teasing the Trial characters players will be able to use during the first cycle of the upcoming Imaginarium Theater game mode. The upcoming Version 4.7 update to the popular HoYoverse RPG has already teased a plethora of new content on the way for the game. Version 4.7 will introduce two new five-star characters to Genshin Impact with Clorinde and Sigewinne, alongside updates to the game's Archon Quest and Genius Invokation TCG. However, one of the most exciting rumors surrounding the update comes with a brand-new game mode.

Imaginarium Theater has been one of the biggest highlights of early leaks surrounding Genshin Impact 's Version 4.7 update. The game mode will reportedly be a new form of endgame content similar to the Spiral Abyss, with players battling against a rotating set of enemies for rewards like Primogems and other in-game resources. Imaginarium Theater is also heavily rumored to allow players to borrow their friends' characters for its challenges, alongside a set of Trial characters. Now, new leaks are hinting at the Imaginarium Theater's first round of Trial characters.

Related
Genshin Impact Leak Teases More Imaginarium Theater Rewards

A recent leak from Genshin Impact is teasing a set of special rewards available for completing the rumored Imaginarium Theater game mode.

A new leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker HomDGCat is detailing the first round of Trial characters for Genshin Impact 's Imaginarium Theater game mode . The post confirms a change from a previous version of the game mode, with Thoma, Shinobu, and Faruzan expected to be available during the update. The game mode had previously seen one of Genshin Impact 's newest characters available, with Version 4.3 four-star character Chevreuse removed from the lineup. The Imaginarium Theater game mode is currently rumored to be launching with Version 4.7 on June 5.

Genshin Impact Leak Hints at Imaginarium Theater 4.7 Trial Characters

  • Thoma : four-star Pyro Polearm character
  • Kuki Shinobu : four-star Electro Sword character
  • Faruzan : four-star Anemo Bow character

The Imaginarium Theater's addition to Genshin Impact is expected to come alongside several changes to Genshin Impact 's pre-existing endgame content. Leaks from Version 4.7 have heavily suggested that the Spiral Abyss will see its rewards increased, with players now able to earn up to 800 Primogems per cycle. However, the change will also include a shift in the dungeon's schedule, with Imaginarium Theater and Spiral Abyss refreshing once per month . Version 4.7 will reportedly increase Genshin Impact 's Friends list cap to 100 as well, coinciding with Imaginarium Theater's borrowing system.

Genshin Impact 's new endgame content highlights a patch looking to be jam-packed with content for fans of the RPG. Version 4.7 will reportedly play host to four events , including a new version of Genshin Impact 's tower defense mini-game dubbed "Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation." Genius Invokation TCG is expected to see a major update as well, with more than 30 new cards being added to the Genshin Impact trading card game. Between the Imaginarium Theater, a new Archon Quest, and TCG updates, players should have plenty to do in Genshin Impact 's next update.

item.title: Some Warner Bros. Games Won't Be Delisted After All
item.description:
Highlights

  • Some Adult Swim Games titles are no longer at risk of being delisted by Warner Bros. Discovery.
  • Developers such as Owen Deery and Landon Podbielski have confirmed their games will not be retired.
  • However, not all developers have received communication from Warner Bros. Discovery, leaving some games still potentially at risk.

Developers of certain Adult Swim Games titles have said Warner Bros.' decision to delist their titles has been seemingly reversed. This past March, parent company Warner Bros. Discovery had shut down the production of several nearly completed films, which earned a lot of backlash. The company was seemingly going to shut down some of its video game offerings as well, with many of them being under the Adult Swim Games label.

The developers of these indie games revealed that 21 Adult Swim Games were at risk of being digitally delisted, including Duck Game , Pool Panic , Rick and Morty: Virtual Rick-ality , and many more. Some of these titles had long shelf lives, with the developers supporting these indie games with years of post-launch community-driven updates. Plans to retire these games were criticized almost immediately, and it appears that Warner Bros. Discovery is walking back on that decision, according to some of the developers of these games.

Related
Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League Was a Massive Financial Flop for Warner Bros.

Recent reports state that Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League was a financial flop for Warner Bros. Discovery.

The news of this reversal was first revealed by Owen Deery, the owner of indie puzzle-adventure game Small Radios Big Televisions , which was first published by Adult Swim Games in 2016. In a new post on his Twitter account, he states Small Radios Big Televisions "will not be 'retired'," contrary to his previous announcement that Warner Bros. Discovery would be digitally delisted. Moreover, ownership and store listings will be returned to Deery as well.

Another developer, Landon Podbielski, who worked on the multiplayer platform shooter Duck Game , confirmed on Twitter that his game was similarly "safe," and that he received an email about how Duck Game 's ownership would be returned to Corptron, along with its store pages on all platforms. Polygon had reached out to a number of other developers who were affected by Warner Bros. Discovery's delisting announcement, confirming that they received similar emails about their titles' ownership rights being transferred to them instead of being delisted.

Some, But Not All Adult Swim Games Are Safe from Delisting

According to Polygon , however, there are some Adult Swim Games developers waiting for further communication from Warner Bros. Discovery. Two developers that spoke with Polygon said they never received the original delisting message from Warner Bros. Discovery back in March, and that they still haven't heard back from the company regarding the status of their games, despite multiple attempts to reach out to the company.

While not all the games are at risk, some titles published by Adult Swim Games could still be delisted . Fans will just need to wait and see if these games will have their ownership returned to their original developers as well.

item.title: Age of Mythology-Like City Builder Citadelum Shares New Gameplay Footage [EXCLUSIVE]
item.description:
Highlights

  • Abylight Studios has shared a new gameplay trailer for Citadelum.
  • The Ancient Rome-set city-builder is set to reach PC in the second half of 2024, with its console ports also being in the works.
  • Citadelum will likely face fierce competition in the strategy games market.

Game Rant can exclusively share new gameplay footage from Citadelum . This strategy game with some serious Age of Mythology vibes is currently targeting a 2024 release for PC , with its console ports also being in the works.

Citadelum is an Ancient Rome-set city-builder that was originally announced in January 2024. Developed by Abylight Barcelona, the game will allow players to build up settlements, establish trade routes on a Civilization -like world map, and lead legions into war. It will also feature some fantastical elements in the form of deities, which are implemented in a way reminiscent of Age of Mythology , especially when combined with the game's genre, setting, and art style.

New Citadelum Trailer Highlights Its Core Mechanics

Five months following its announcement, Game Rant can now share some new footage from Citadelum . The exclusive 80-second video goes over some of the game's mechanics, like setting up resource gathering and refinement operations, as well as building out settlements. The clip also offers a fresh look at the game's world map, which will be used for establishing commerce routes and deploying legions. Another one of the game's mechanics featured in the trailer is its system of worship, which allows players to honor gods with pantheons and tributes, something that fans of Roman history are likely to appreciate.

True to the ancient mythology that inspired it, the gods in Citadelum aren't all benevolent, but prone to very human behavior such as mood swings and ruthlessness. They also have rivalries, so honoring one may incur the wrath of another. Keeping these divine beings happy is one of the three defining pillars of the Citadelum gameplay loop, together with city-building and strategic expansion through commerce, warfare, or a combination thereof.

Citadelum Narrows Down 2024 Release Window

Publisher Abylight Studios originally announced Citadelum with a 2024 release window. Game Rant has learned that this launch time frame has now been narrowed down to Q3 2024, at least as far as the PC version of the game, which can already be wishlisted on Steam , is concerned. Console ports are also in the pipeline, with the plan being to launch them following the PC release, which will be Steam Deck-verified.

Citadelum hence appears poised to debut at quite a busy time for the strategy games market; plenty more city-builders are currently either close to release or awaiting significant updates after launching in early access. Many strategy fans are also currently keeping an eye out for Age of Mythology Retold , which is still waiting for a release date after being confirmed for a 2024 debut. Whether Citadelum manages to find an audience among this fierce competition remains to be seen.

More
8 Best Strategy Games For Short Play Sessions

Players with limited playtime can still enjoy the strategy genre through these video games that are perfect even for shorter play sessions.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Achieves New Success on PC
item.description:
Highlights

  • Cyberpunk 2077 has achieved "Overwhelmingly Positive" reviews on Steam, a stark contrast to its troubled launch in 2020.
  • CD Projekt Red has dedicated time to improving the game through updates and patches, leading to a positive reception.
  • The Phantom Liberty expansion DLC released in late 2023 further enhanced the game's reputation and player experience.

Cyberpunk 2077 has reached Overwhelmingly Positive reviews on Steam. Cyberpunk 2077 is an action-RPG developed by CD Projekt Red and released in 2020. Set in Night City, players assume the role of V, a mercenary navigating a world of advanced technology, corporate greed, and societal upheaval. The open world gameplay includes branching dialogue, different character classes, and combat.

Cyberpunk 2077 has gone through a roller coaster ride with a disastrous launch due to numerous bugs and missing features. However, the game's developers have been dedicated to improving it through multiple updates and patches. They released Cyberpunk 2077 's update 2.12 in February 2024, fixing newer bugs and issues. Despite its initial setbacks, the game has continued to evolve, with recent efforts culminating in a notable achievement on the Steam platform.

3:18
Related
Cyberpunk 2077: 26 Tips To Get Off To A Good Start As A Beginner

Cyberpunk 2077 might seem a little intimidating at first, but these tips should make things easier for newcomers.

Cyberpunk 2077 Finally Reached Overwhelmingly Positive Reviews

Recently, Cyberpunk 2077's rank in the "Recent Reviews" category reached "Overwhelmingly Positive" on Steam . This success on Steam is evident in the numbers, with 95% of the 7,103 user reviews filed in the last 30 days being positive, leading to the "Overwhelmingly Positive" classification. Cyberpunk 2077 's all-time reviews on Steam are now "Very Positive" with 83% positive reviews out of 651,068. This positive reception reflects a stark contrast to the game's troubled launch. CDPR Associate Game Director, Pawe Sasko, thanked the players for a second chance on his recent Twitter post.

After several review bombing incidents, it took two and a half years for Cyberpunk 2077 to get an overall "Very Positive" status on Steam . To achieve that status, the devs had to release several patches and bug fixes to make the game playable on all the platforms. The price of the game has also been reduced several times, even though the initial price was quite high.

The achievement of "Overwhelmingly Positive" reviews on Steam came long after the release of the Phantom Liberty expansion DLC, released in late 2023, which provided players with additional content. Cyberpunk 2077 's Phantom Liberty DLC elevated the game's reputation even further. With new gameplay options, features, and improvements, the DLC offers players an enriched gaming experience, potentially putting previous criticisms to rest.

Aside from the review bombings and bugs, the game actually offers a great setting. Cyberpunk 2077 is celebrated for its environmental storytelling , offering players a rich and immersive experience. Night City serves as the vibrant yet gritty backdrop for Cyberpunk 2077 , featuring a carefully crafted environment filled with intricate details and storytelling cues.

item.title: Twitter Responds to Nintendo Dropping Support of the Platform on Switch
item.description:
Highlights

  • Nintendo's decision to restrict media sharing from the Switch on Twitter affects users, but guidelines can help players share via smartphones.
  • Twitter expressed regret over losing the Switch feature but remains committed to a strong working relationship with Nintendo for future endeavors.
  • While Nintendo's decision impacts Twitter initially, Facebook may also be affected by restrictions on sharing images and videos from Switch in the future.

Twitter has issued an official response to Nintendo's previously announced decision to no longer allow players to post screenshots, videos, or friend requests to the social media platform from their Switch consoles. Although the social media company's post expresses regret that Switch media sharing will no longer be possible on the platform, it also expresses a hopeful tone for future endeavors between the two companies.

A few days previously, Nintendo had announced that the Switch feature would be going away on June 10, 2024, with more specific media-sharing restrictions on some high-profile Nintendo games, such as Super Smash Bros. Ultimate and the Splatoon series. While Nintendo did not give an official reason for this decision, one additional change concerning Splatoon 3 states that images posted from the mailbox will no longer be uploaded to social media platforms, instead going directly to Nintendo servers, allowing for players who don't have social media accounts to still display their in-game captures. However, images posted by users under the age of 13 will not be viewable by anyone but the account holder.

Related
Nintendo Forecast Suggests Switch 2 Release Date Will Be Later Than Expected

Nintendo's latest forecast for the current fiscal year suggests the highly anticipated Switch 2 will launch later than expected.

The official response from Twitter was posted to the platform's official xGaming account on May 10, 2024. In Twitter's response to the disabling of the Switch feature , the social media company claims it still has a strong ongoing working relationship with Nintendo, and that the two companies are continuing to work together to ensure that the transition away from the sharing feature goes smoothly. The post also states that Twitter had tried to work with Nintendo to keep the feature intact, but the decision to pull it from the Switch was ultimately made by Nintendo. Despite these claims, the post contains a community note speculating that Nintendo's decision may have been influenced by Twitter's hefty monthly fee for companies accessing its Application Programming Interface, or API.

There Are Still Ways to Share to Twitter from Switch

While Nintendo's decision affects the ways that games can use social media , the announcement from Twitter contains some useful guidelines that will allow Switch players to continue to share their screenshots and videos on the social media platform, though it will take an extra step moving forward. Instead of uploading the media files directly to Twitter from their Switch consoles, players will instead have to send the media files to their smartphones and upload them to Twitter from there.

Nintendo's recent decision to remove the feature from Switch doesn't seem directly targeted at Twitter, though that platform is taking the biggest hit initially. Facebook will also be affected by the changes to Splatoon 3 coming on June 10, and while sharing images and videos directly to Facebook from Switch won't be disabled immediately, Nintendo's statement suggests that the feature may be removed in the future.
